title: I’m trying to write a book about a wealthy, Russian family during the Bolshevik Revolution, First World War, and the Second World War. Can someone help we with what happened to the wealthy during these times in the Motherland? - Quora

response.answer_text: That would depend on how close they were to the Bolshevik leaders and even that was no guarantee of safety. After the Communists took over Russia using the PMRC, they consolidated gains by killing every Capitalist and Royalist they could find and then there was the Civil War (1918 - 1923). By Stalin’s reign (1923 - 1953) that also spread to the Kulaks and anyone else considered to be the bourgeois. The best way to survive something like that was to get the hell out of the country. A wealthy Russian family in exile might be more doable.
